titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frederick Bland Collection of Sketches of the Yale Art and Architecture Building by Paul Rudolph
Bland (Frederick) Collection of Sketches of the Yale Art and Architecture Building by Paul Rudolph
titlestmt.author: compiled by Laura Tatum and William Landis

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:17

did.unittitle: Frederick Bland collection of sketches of the Yale Art and Architecture Building by Paul Rudolph

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection comprises four graphite-on-tracing paper sketches by Paul Rudolph of the fenestration of the Yale Art and Architecture Building. The drawings are significant in that they demonstrate how Rudolph would have originally subdivided the large glass in the building's windows.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frederick Bland Collection of Sketches of the Yale Art and Architecture Building by Paul Rudolph (MS 1933). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 2009, Frederick Bland is a managing partner in the firm Beyer Blinder Belle Architects and Planners LLP. He received his Bachelor of Arts (1968) and Master of Architecture (1972) degrees from Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises four graphite-on-tracing paper sketches by Paul Rudolph of the fenestration of the Yale Art and Architecture Building. The drawings are significant in that they demonstrate how Rudolph would have originally subdivided the large glass in the building's windows.

controlaccess.corpname: Yale Art and Architecture Building (New Haven, Conn.)
